_meanings:
{@--7@} A practice
prevalent in ancient times which
permitted a childless widow to have
intercourse with the brother or any
near kinsman of her deceased 
husband to raise up issue to him, the
son so born being called {#kzetraja#}; <ab>cf.</ab>
<ls>Ms. 9. 59</ls>: --{#devarAdvA sapiMqAdvA striyA samyaN#}
{#niyuktayA . prajepsitADigaMtavyA saMtAnasya#} 
{#parikzaye ..#}; see <ls n="Ms. 9.">60</ls>, <ls n="Ms. 9.">65</ls> also. (Vyāsa 
begot {#pAMqu#} and {#DftarAzwra#} on the widows of
{#vicitravIrya#} in this way).
